content: Great! It's nice to connect with you. How are you feeling today? There's no rush—take your time if you need.
Honestly, I feel drained. Things at home have been overwhelming, and I’m struggling to keep up. I’m here because I know I need help, but I’m not convinced this will make a difference.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot right now, and that can feel exhausting. It's really brave of you to reach out despite feeling uncertain about this process. What’s been feeling the most overwhelming for you lately?

Honestly, it's everything—my son acting out, the tension with my wife, and feeling disconnected from my daughter. I just feel like I'm failing both at home and at work. It's like there's no part of my life where I can catch my breath.

You're dealing with so much all at once—family, work, and the pressure you're putting on yourself. It's no wonder you feel like you can't catch your breath. It sounds like you're juggling a lot of roles and expectations. What’s been the weightiest part of all this for you right now?
Honestly, it's my son. I feel like I can't figure out how to help him, and it's tearing everything apart—my marriage, my connection with my daughter, even my own peace of mind.

It sounds like your concern for your son weighs heavily on your heart, and you're feeling the impact it's having on your relationships and inner calm. You clearly care a great deal about your family. What do you think is the biggest challenge when it comes to helping your son?

I think the biggest challenge is that I just don’t know what he needs or how to reach him. My wife and I have tried different things, but nothing seems to work, and it’s frustrating and disheartening. It feels like no matter what we do, we’re only making things worse.

It’s clear how deeply you and your wife want to support your son, and it’s frustrating when your efforts don’t seem to make a difference. It sounds like you’re both trying really hard, but the uncertainty about what he truly needs is making this even harder. What do you notice about him that leaves you feeling unsure of what he needs?
